hLm1AA4LIoPBr7P1gUhHWQ.text: Nothing special. Good wasn't as good as i anticipated. You can find better for cheaper elsewhere. Decent drinks and our waitress was nice and attentive, for that I'll give 3 stars.

N4O8gKpdhxA2_dy6HdR-1A.text: Food sucked horse feet. Super slow. Food was absolutely disgusting. Nice Staff. Don't waste your time and money at this place. IT SUCKS

DrMXxOlIv0NoZ4XqIN2fzQ.text: I ate here twice during a conference. After my first experience I would not have chosen to return, but we had a big group, and I was more interested in being with friends than pushing restaurant choice.   I judge Mexican places on four basics: guacamole, tacos, salsa, and margaritas. I set out to give Vida two stars, but had to bump it up to three when I realized that the only terrible thing out of these four was the tacos. But the tacos were bad. So bad. If I cannot finish a taco? Bad. The salsa and guacamole were fair. The margaritas were excellent., especially the pomegranate variety (but $11? Really? Stupid.)   The ceviche was not good, and was also not technically ceviche. I don't know what the sauce was they drenched it in, but ease up there, chief. Simple: lime, garlic, a little spice -- that's all you need. Not whatever the red stuff was. Ick. I also tried tortilla soup on the lunch visit, and didn't care for that either.   The service was accommodating both times, especially for our large dinner group, so that also ranks the extra star. But really, in my heart, it's two for a bad taco.

x0e23g1fbWOv0--E43acxw.text: Great location as part of the Epicentre in Uptown Charlotte. Food was OK, nothing special. The atmosphere was a little lacking and somewhat non-existent.

XP1tohjRZhI1fcwsasdEvQ.text: As I walked on to vida today I expected a lot from such a beautiful restauraunt , we started off with a agua de watermelon which was delicious and a really nice waitress (yesenia) she was very attentive wandered all our questions, I was really happy till we got our food even though the prices were affordable I did expect much more , I ordered the Cobb salad and it was good my sister ordered carne asad and it was way over cooked , 2 eggs instead of three which is what we paid for . I would go back but this restauraunt need a way better chef iin Mexican and this was not authentic !

_9WX-4q3O85Ksm4IlWSXyQ.text: Sorry this place had so much promise but did not deliver.  Walking by, I saw the same kind of custom guacamole bowls that I experienced at Cantina Laredo in Nashville, TN.  The guac was excellent and the highlight of the meal.  I thought I would try something different and that was a mistake - I had the Carnitas, and found them almost impossible to eat.  Every bite had sharp edges that cut like a knife, and the meat underneath was very dry.  I'll probably go back so I can update my review, but next time it will be something different.

9lowiDN27IIK-TAfFwrD2Q.text: I went in for brunch here today, I was with a party of 6 including one person who actually works here. That being said, you would think we would have had excellent service and our orders correct.. Instead, terribly slow service, orders incorrect/incomplete. Had my friend not been an employee I would have insisted on asking for a manager. For starters, drinks from the bar took about 10 minutes if not longer to arrive at the table. For a restaurant less than half full, that is too long. As for the food, I asked for no jalapenos on my potatoes. They come out with it and our server quickly notices and offers to bring me another serving of them. She does and now they are without cheese.. Whatever, fine. Next two from our table are missing the bacon from their order, ask for it and the server brings them ONE serving and asks if that's ok.. Really.. Really? Sure, that's fine they would love to share 2 pieces of bacon. Who shares bacon? I believe had a member of the party not been an employee we may have had different treatment, but you would have thought we would have at least gotten a prompt service as well as accurate orders. Shame on the chef, and shame on the server or whoever checks plates at the window for overlooking 3 out of 6 plates. I wouldn't recommend brunch here, there are many other options in the Charlotte uptown area.

q2UWGS0UGsjmyQncDrzOlA.text: Went here for a private event. We got there slightly early but our table was ready to go and the server was on point with taking our drink and app orders while we waited for everyone else to get there.   We got seated upstairs and yes, the floor is really slippery. Have someone to hold onto and be careful going up and down the stairs too.   The upstairs was awesome! I wanna sit here every time. It had its own bar and waitstaff. Our waiter and waitress were awesome! They were so attentive and even with our large group they were patient and got everything right.  We got the margaritas, crab nachos and taquitos. Even splitting it, it was too much food and we were very hungry when we got there. The portions were overwhelming and since the food was heavy, we got full quickly.   They had some wonderful desserts on the menu but we didn't get to try them, next time for sure.  A few notes, there is valet service or you can park in the Epicentre garage. Valet is 15/20? and Parking is 10bucks typically. You can also take the light rail, the stop is right behind the restaurant. Get the back bean plantain mash, I didn't get it but I tried my brother's and it was good.

PPeat8X_m5d4a4JLtLn6xA.text: My experience in this restaurant was horrible to say the least. The only reason I am giving them stars is because the food is good..and I have to give something.   We were in Charlotte for a concert at Time Warner. The event started at 7 so we made reservations for 5:30. We checked in and were taken to a table in about 5 minutes. It took about 10 minutes to be greeted. Our servers name was Shelby. We were waiting on a friend who was stuck in traffic  so we ordered drinks and an appetizer. The drinks took 25 minutes. We also went ahead and ordered dinner because we did not want to be late for the event. It's now 615 and we stil don't have dinner. When our friend showed up she ordered a margarita from the bar and her dinner...the margarita took another  20 minutes and was delivered in a plastic cup half full. (Her food never came) Our food finally arrived around 635pm. As soon as the food was delivered we asked Shelby for our checks and boxes...at 650 we had to call a manger over to ask for our checks again...when Shelby finally brought them back they had ran my card twice...and my friends not at all. It's now 655 and I have to try to get my check fixed....I went to the host stand and asked for a different manager to fix my checks because I am now late at this point. I asked her to fix it and when she asked me how everything was I said horrible and she said to just not worry about it. It has now been a full 7 days and the hold is still on my account.   I will not be returning to this restaurant. Like I said, the food is good but if you are going to be across the street from a major venue like that then you need to be more prepared for a rush before showtime. Everyone in there was in a hurry and there were people seated after us that left before us. Such a shame, such a great location.

GZ9VPEZcb7zzC4TGkP2_bA.text: As an Angeleno, I was pleasantly surprised to find that Vida holds its own against some of the better taco places in LA. Sure, it's not Grand Central Market where there's sawdust on the floor and a guy in a stand serves you one pound cabeza tacos on a double layer of freshly made corn tortillas, but this is the Epicenter of Uptown Charlotte, NC. I wasn't expecting much. In fact, from the outside, I thought I was going to get stuck with overpriced, Americanized Mexican food. I was mistaken.  My colleagues and I ended up splitting an order of the guacamole. $8.99 seemed mighty pricey at first, but they give you a veritable fuck ton of it in a mortar-style bowl and it was friggin delicious. Granted, it wasn't made fresh at the table (oh how I wish it was), but it was very nice. Lots of avocado, both on the front of the palate from the first bite and also in the large chunks that were mixed in.   I ordered a lunch special of the house salad plus a carnitas taco. The salad was above average, with a healthy mix of greens, a slice of avocado and some corn. The black beans + rice was surprisingly tasty, maybe even ranking near the top of what I've had. Black beans especially were sinfully fatty.  The taco was excelente. Carnitas were tender and full of juicy flavor, showing that they had indeed been marinated and then cooked over several hours. The tortilla was warm and melted in my mouth. If it wasn't made fresh that day, it sure tasted like it.  Overall, the lunch was fairly light: one medium-sized taco, a small mix of rice and beans and a small house salad. Were it not for the guacamole, I would have walked away feeling pretty good about my portions.  Will I race back here? Probably not. But it's a solid place to have lunch or dinner... and I'm dying to try out their tequila selection.

gtdFjBFOPXt9PU3PJKlVYw.text: My wife and I went to Vida's based on good Yelp! reviews.  Once again, we were not disappointed.  Made a reservation through Open Table and were seated at a great table on time.  The restaurant was very busy due to the Eric Clapton concert later that evening.  Our server (Rick?) was awesome - perfect balance of knowledge, presentation and attention.  Chips and salsa were very good.  I had the Vida Chicken and my wife had the Lump Crab Nachos.  The chicken was good + although the queso was a bit much.  The crab tacos were a perfect small meal for my wife.  Nice, fun experience with good food, service and atmosphere.

p5UP6Sbvg8zakcNV4O3M9A.text: Overpriced, loud patrons & food is not very good.  Go to Aztecas for best food in Charlotte and at a very reasonable price.

QPrhg9XIwYKGyUp93stB9Q.text: Delicious Food, great service... (Carnitas tacos were perfect) I also tried the taco salad which had spectacular guacamole and a nice selection of margaritas to spare

sj55DnX6ZVH2ikECMkDpuw.text: We came here the other night to just grab a round of drinks before we headed to dinner at a different place - but after 1 hour, 1 pitcher of sangria, and 4 mojitos - we were hooked. Not sure if it was the drinks or the addicting chips and salsa they kept feeding us. Either way - we ended up spending close to another 2 hours drinking and eating. For dinner I would recommend the chicken and shrimp fajita. It's delicious and serves enough food for two!   Oh and love the atmosphere....and the music!

b_YQFN-yu8IIGfL_doGn6Q.text: Great location. Cool vibe. Attentive service. . .and, sadly, that's it. We had been looking forward to trying this place for quite some time since we have seen it front center at the EpiCentre.  We finally got the chance and were completely underwhelmed.  First we started with some margaritas--these should be an easy way to please anyone. They weren't.   The skinny margarita was just awful and I've had some good ones at other places in town (such as 1900 Mexican Grill which has a fantastic one). The regular margarita was just passable.  Perhaps the premium margaritas ones are better but I suspect we won't be back to try again.  The chips and salsa were really quite good.   After devouring 2 bowls of chips because they were so good we  figured the food would dazzle us.  We could not decide among all of the delicious offerings so tried 2 of the combo platters to try a good variety of the food.  They were chock full of good quality ingredients (crab, shrimp, fish, avocados) but somehow were rendered almost tasteless. Nothing stood out, except for the fact that the soft corn tortillas were greasy. The food at a casual burrito shop is easily more pleasing.  In college I worked in an average Mexican restaurant and the entrees here didn't even come close.   The banana tres leches cake for dessert was intensely flavored (nice change from the bland meal) but really good (if you don't fear banana flavor). It isn't a traditional tres leches so the waiter tried to steer us away from it.  I understand why, but it was very good and potent.  All in all this was a disappointment (chips, salsa and dessert excepted) and we love Mexican food. Not sure if we'd waste the calories on another try when there are so many other Mexican options in the Queen City.  That's too bad because the location is great and there aren't any other Mexican places uptown.

cXxQ1GvL4DQtft4GrD-lZw.text: Kinda surprised this place only has a 3.5 average rating.   I really like Vida. I have been here several times over the last year and always had a good experience. The margaritas were outstanding and the portions were pretty sizable (I couldn't finish my meal!). And oh, the ceviche cocktail is heavenly (I included that in one of my tips). I get a fair amount of really good Mexican food in Chicago and Vida sizes up pretty well.

YSXYi8iXw0DgWqLQiaifRQ.text: Vida is a great spot to bring friends or family, or grab a drink and yummy mexican with a date.  We had a lovely time, great margaritas, great atmosphere for people watching but quiet enough for chatting and serviced was incredibly attentive.  Highlights:  Crab Nachos Taquitos Queso Dip Carne Asada  We will definitely return!

owjUijd3hjAaidB0mGb6IA.text: Really like this place!  You aren't going to find a Speedy Gonzales on the menu, that's for sure.  Fresh, interesting food, friendly waitstaff and great outdoor seating on a nice night.   The chips and salsa are good (as I've mentioned, I judge a Mexican restaurant on their chips and salsa), the enchiladas are really nice (especially the corn/chicken, shrimp/crab and mushroom) and the sides are great.  The plantain black bean mash is my favorite followed very closely by the plantains.    This place hits the list each time I'm staying in uptown Charlotte.

fVpLNr-zSk0OGu7gPShQUQ.text: Delicious. From the drinks to deserts. Waitress was nice. I guess her name is Ashley. Definitely deserves 5 stars!

p0sqDWs3CC9XLVLwkncGDg.text: Great location, good service, good but not spectacular food. A litte pricy for the food you get, but considering the location it's reasonable. If you are already uptown and feel like Mexican food its a good choice. I would not recommend making a special trip uptown for it as it's nothing special.

n4idtrkT3tstyt6OBQboGw.text: Came to Charlotte on a business trip and decided to try this place since it was conveniently across the street to my hotel. It was a nice restaurant and seems like a good happy hour spot since it has an outdoor area that faces the street. I was disappointed that with only 4 strict combo options that you aren't able to substitute any of the items. I decided to go with the combo that had a carne asada taco, chicken taco and pork avocado enchilada. The tacos were really tasty but really greasy. The enchilada had a cinnamon flavor which I thought was weird; not bad, just different. The margarita was ok; nothing too exciting. I was surprised that the service wasn't better since it seemed like a light day.

l_MdblrlfAF4DMn0mNQvJg.text: Went to Vida this past Sunday with my family after a friend suggested this place.  I am always in the mood for good Mexican food, so we headed uptown for this place.  We sat outside, on the bar side since the dine-in side was pretty crowded.  I thought that the crowd meant the food was good, so I was happy.  We were pretty hungry so we ordered the Chips and Salsa and added the Guacamole for an appetizer.  My wife and daughter shared in the 6 tacos platter while I opted for the Nachos and added some groud beef at an additional charge.  The service was decent.  Nothing really special, but I felt like we were taken care of.  The Chips arrived first and were pretty good.  The Salsa was Fantastic!!  Probably my favorite part of the meal.  The Guacamole left a lot to be desired.  My wife and I both agreed that it was pretty bland and needed some salt to heighten the flavor.  My Nachos were ok.  My only knock on is that the ground beef was also very bland.  It really had no taste.  The 6 Tacos platter included 2 veggie tacos, 2 fried chicken tacos and 2 grilled chicken tacos.  I was surprised to see that the soft flour tortillas were fried and therefore, were very greasy.  I was not a fan of that and neither was my wife.    For drinks, we ordered 2 ginger ales and 1 lemonade for my daughter.  My wife thought the lemonade tasted like what they would use for a Margarita.  Overall, we spent about $45 including a 15% tip.  So I don't think the place is too bad price-wise, considering we got plenty of food.  But I wish the flavors were more vibrant.  The waitress did mention that the menu is different with more options on the dine-in side of the venue, so I might give this place another chance some day since we were sitting on the "bar" side.

50sTIKGA2zyCwZbP7T3csw.text: The girlfriend and I visited Vida last week because of a Mexican food craving that I had. I absolutely love enchiladas, so I figured I couldn't go wrong w/ my order of chicken enchiladas. Boy was I wrong.. No flavor at all and the outside was like gnawing on chewy cardboard.   Even though I was very displeased with my order, the girlfriend was happy w/ her taco salad so I figure I'd give 2 stars based on her opinion.

xvrJNJhIASNHXC90_q7kVQ.text: Tasty guac. strong drinks. In the heart of Downtown Charlotte day and night life.  - Fresh Guacamole - White Sangria - Negra Modelo on draft

VCe5dtzx_W1kZoGzXV5gQA.text: I've been to Vida plenty of times. I'm a lover of all things Mexican. And tequila. And cheese. Anywho... I've had my share of good dishes here and some not so good. Not bad just... ehhh... here's the deal.   Years ago when the hot spot first opened, I would go constantly simply for the queso fundido. It was a thing with my friend Ray and myself to hit up the Checkers games then walk over to Vida and snag some cheese and drinks. However, sadly, they took the fundido away. Sigh... Vida, feel free to bring that back at any point. Nonetheless they still have queso but it doesn't hold a candle to the fundido.   If I go for lunch, I always get the ABLT - thats avocado on a BLT. It comes with a cilantro mayo but that's not my thing so I ask them to 86 the mayo, side of honey mustard. The sandwich is light and comes on an almost ciabatta-like bun.   If I do dinner, I get the crab meat nachos time and time again. Topped with crab meat, melted cheese, mashed black beans and avocado (hi, I'm Nikki and I love avocado). The nachos are individually crafted, piled high on each chip with yummy goodness.   Last time I went I got the ahi tuna salad. The ahi tuna was cooked mid-rare, absolutely perfect, but the ingredients in the salad didn't seem to jive. This is the ehhh I was talking about earlier. And the cilantro lime dressing left me a bit disappointed. For an appetizer, we had some type of mushroom wraps which I'd say go ahead and skip.   However, if you have a margarita craving, this is the place to quench your thirst. Variety of styles. A pleathra of tequila choices. And a good number of flavors to choose from.

QE-Rwg5dMAORo7pPsKynYg.text: How could you pass this place and go to any other restaurant at the Epicentre?  I will start by saying...I absolutely dislike mexican food. I've never been a fan and will choose a grilled steak over mexican fare, any day. But this place was soooo trendy that I had to try it.  My boyfriend and I started at the bar with Margaritas and wholly guacamole and tortilla chips! Yum, Yum, Yum. The drinks were superb and my boyfriend loved all of the tvs. The drinks here are very creative and you will want to try more than one.  I ordered the chicken enchilada accompanied with some sort of corn side dish. I am a corn freak! That corn stuff was tasty! The enchilada was good (remember i don't like mexican) but I wouldn't order it again. My boyfriend loves any kind of food. He ordered the chicken fajitas and plantains.  He never picked his head up. Lol. He was in heaven. He doesn't even do that when I cook. :O  4 stars because service was great, the place is trendy, the drinks are great, if you love mexican food...you'll love this place.  I didn't have a problem with the music...I like dancing at the table. hehe

BPjzJFdEQq0pmSpuEb58ww.text: A solid 3.5 stars for Vida.  I went here for a friends birthday and we sat on the patio area.  I loved seeing the views of the city and enjoyed the location.  It is a bit hustle and bustle, but I love that atmosphere.  For apps I had the guacamole and cheese dip.  The guacamole is so incredible.  I also had a cheese quesadilla and it was decent enough.  The margaritas were on special here and it was nice to have a good drink and sit back and watch the views.  I think the guacamole and service were great here.  Its not your typical mexican fare and I think next time I will order something a little more special to Vida!

hFCmMyo7D8avGK39KZIgXg.text: Weekday dinner. Tried the ahi tuna, guac n salad. They got the flavours right. Tuna was done just tight. Guac had a kick to it and salad was fresh. The churros were the best part with a crisp finish, sugary texture and an awesome chocolate sauce. Not bad for a work night! Didn't try any drinks though.

u1Rb-Rlx4iogpggDbrjkiQ.text: This place is trendy and has a decent atmosphere if you care about that...The best thing was the Guacamole.  It was fresh and there was plenty of it so that was a plus.  The entrees were over-priced and bland at best.  I ordered the marinated shrimp tacos and it looked and tasted like cocktail shrimp, just a bit warmer...every other flavor blended together.    We had a party of 6 and none of us enjoyed our meals.  Everyone had the same feedback..:"it was bland."  If you go to a Mexican restaurant you expect the flavors to POP!  This is NOT traditional mexican--obviously--and the only way you would even know it was supposed to be a mexican restaurant is because they serve chips and salsa.  The service was not that great and it felt rushed, especially as it started to get more crowded.  They just seemed unorganized.    The thing that annoyed me about this "nicer" restaurant is that after taking two bites of my shrimp cocktail taco, I put it down and didn't touch the rest on my plate.  I did eat the refried blacked beans and they were pretty yummy...but other than that--my plate looked untouched.  As a waiter, you should realize that someone didn't touch their food and ask if everything is okay--I was a waitress for several years and that is just basic server 101.  If you care at all about repeat customers and their opinions then you need to take notice if they didn't eat their meal...at least ASK if everything is okay.  I'm not saying he had to comp the meal or anything like that but to just act oblivious is also just ridiculous.  There are soooo many amazing mexican restaurants that are more affordable, half the drama, and way more authentic.  Save your money and go somewhere else.

qeX7OzQth0_61ISCzVRcKg.text: Food and atmosphere were amazing. My friend and I recently visited Charlotte and had lunch at Vida. Service was great and food is wonderful. I had the Vida salad with red chile chicken and he had the pork tacos, both were to die for! If even back in Charlotte I know we will return.

OPB1syHtkyhBttvs8oMa4w.text: Get to the Chase:  Pros: 1) Waiters are very polite and attentive. Love it!  2) Great for mimosas! PERFECT pre-game, post-game, and any game.  3) Reasonably priced, you'll leave feeling you got what you paid for without having a lighter wallet  Cons: 1) Sadly, the food doesn't come up to par with the drinks...nothing special, just overly thought dishes 2) Completely empty at peak lunch hours, which should have been fair warning to not indulge my hunger at such a place  Overall, I've had better mexican...gives you the tacky feeling of a mexican chain (whether that be True or not, I just felt like I'd be better off at a Chipotle or Qdoba)

_sa95Bbkd0sum-tZioGqhA.text: Really Charlotte?  This your version of Mexican food?  This place besides being in the heart of Charlotte isn't that great.  The food is a cut below a fast food Mexican joint.  The outside part is nice and there are some good things like the sangria drinks but that is about all folks.  If you are there to chill outside for drinks and maybe some apps this is a three star.

7fjRTa9R5cpJSm0ap7kasw.text: I like to reserve my 4-5 stars for places that totally blew my mind...though this comes extremely close! Pretty confusing that Vida and Vida Vida are two different restaurants, but the more elegant section has good food, decent drinks, and the bartender was very helpful in food and drink selections. The skinny margarita is not excellent but it is mostly tequila and artificial sweetener so, for what it is it's okay. Other margaritas are okay but they don't have much of a drink selection otherwise. Overall a good experience.

0gQq1jzdO6uTV2pCDsMYYA.text: The service is excellent. Friendly staff. Knowledgeable about the food. The shrimp appetizers were great. The guacamole was good. The chips were bland. My shrimp tacos were flavor less. They seriously need to learn how to season their food. Second time I've been there and the food needed a kick. I won't be back.

uB8oPs2Xmq2DCaC_M0nFjA.text: Taco Sociale Tuesdays. I shouldn't have to say anything else.  $2 tacos, $3 modelo and great service - at Epicentre There are other great specials on other days that in combination with other nearby events and specials make Vida the perfect start to any Uptown Charlotte evening.   I don't too much care for the chips, but the salsa is nice. The tacos were.... tacos.... so yeah... that.  There's a patio. It's awesome. you can sit on it and people watch quite effectively.  I recommend it.   And coronaritas.

UlIYgwe1oawlxf_pWsWuKg.text: I've been here many times but unfortunately my last experience was not what I call a good one. I ordered the chicken and corn enchiladas and became incredibly sick. All symptoms pointed to mild food poisoning and I felt horrible for 3 days straight. Just because of this one experience I will most likely not be returning, mainly due to the fear factor of getting sick again. Vida Cantina, I recommend to start hiring chefs that know how to handle food properly because this is unacceptable. I truly hope no one else shared a similar experience.

ndbZrIaHwKGrzNX3fcK3Tw.text: Let's start by saying that the location is fantastic! Uptown is always fun! The food, however, was just ok. I got the ground beef tacos and there just wasn't any great flavor to them.. Or to the beans and rice on the side. The drinks were great... Melon and dragon berry mojitos! So good! The service was good, too. Server was attentive but not clingy. Overall, I'd recommend for late night but not dinner or lunch.

L3MsLW6H7gx14dJBsqrakQ.text: Came here yesterday with a girlfriend for the $2 taco Tuesday special. We were seated quickly and before we got settled at our table we had chips and salsa placed on our table (which was amazing!) I ordered a mango margarita that was oh-so-good. I ordered 3 tacos: 1) Fish taco was my least favorite. It was fresh tasting but seemed it needed more seasoning. Probably better fried. 2) Beef taco was good. Typical. 3) Chicken red chile taco was great! The grilled onions and spicy sauce made the taste even more complex and tasty. The only downfall with service was that our waiter made us feel a little rushed to leave near the end of our meal. Outside of that, overall good experience. I'll definitely be back. But probably only for the taco Tuesday as the prices seem a little high to me for Tex-Mex cuisine.

aQ1ohlM6QrW4BfBH8IwFDA.text: I've been to Vida twice now - once for lunch and once for dinner. And both times have been great experiences.  For dinner, we had the unbelievably awesome tableside guacamole served with not one or two, but THREE avocados!  Wow - the portion was huge but the four of us were able to polish it off.  He he!  The tacos are served three for dinner, two for lunch.  You also get to choose two sides for dinner and one for lunch. I tried the shrimp tacos for dinner and they were very tasty! I had the green rice and fried plantains, both delicious. On my lunch excursion, I had the carne asada tacos. They were pretty good as well, and I had a repeat of the plantains for my side, I loved them that much (just be prepared for a bit of grease.)  On both trips, we had reservations, were seated promptly, and service was exemplary.    Vida is a great addition to EpiCentre and we will definitely be back!

v9rwqEGj6FFtPlXZQQwTvQ.text: Lunch at Vidas, party of 3. Satisfied orders, 1 of 3...  Vidas is in a prime location, hence gets a fair amount of business just due to that fact.  Then what? Their food was probably between 3-4 stars, note the "was". I had not gone to Vidas for 2-3 months, but this visit was a severe disappointment. Not only did they raise the prices on their menus, they made it so you can't select your side from their list of sides when ordering from 3/4 of the menu.  Let's get onto the food... there is something to be said about a restaurant when the chips and salsa are the best thing for your meal. I ordered a Cobb Salad, but due to the "loudness" in the restaurant, the order was taken as a House Salad. Sigh... I was in a rush, so I did not have them make a new salad. Either way, the salad was ALOT of iceberg lettuce. There was 1/4 of an avocado, some corn, and simple beans. Fairly bland dressing... all for $7. I am not sure what part of that salad constitutes the extra $4, maybe the location?  Another person ordered a ground beef taco. People at Qdoba, Chipotle, or any of the fast food "Mexican" joints at least know how to drain the fat from the meat before putting it into the taco shell. Vida apparently does not understand this process. The taco my friend got was a soggy mess dripping with grease. When you can see your reflection on the taco, not good.  The review would probably side on the lower end of 2 stars, I was debating giving only 1 star.

rqFVkZYnGfB1sttLOSTeuA.text: I've been here a couple of times now and both times I've been unimpressed. The food was decent, but nothing to write home about. I could get over that if the prices were really low, but they aren't. But I'm not sure I should have expected anything less at the Epicenter.

7Il38yLhHmEhiOf-eHlBWA.text: Definitely was not expecting the prices here. Tacos were over $12.00! When we got the food, the rice inside my burrito still had a crunch to it. My husband's enchiladas were good. The salsa was amazing!

Yyj_Lgj2fyUtFE5iqgclmA.text: Great location - right in the epicenter of Uptown Charlotte!  Service was top notch (highly recommend Raymond as your waiter!) and the food inventive!   Fresh, flavorful and nice variety to choose from the regular menu or specials!  Great selection of local craft brews as well.    Great night with friends and family, taking in the young, vibrant scene of uptown!

y-kb6Zhs71XmxwLQMxNr4A.text: I wish there was a zero! Friend and I decided to sit outside, we were seated by the hostess! Waitress (short girl, short hair, unhappy face) brings our drinks, chips and salsa... no napkins or silverware at this point. Waiter brings our food, we ask for some napkins very politely since we didn't have a single one (although we were served chips/salsa/drinks-BUT no napkins). He leaves, a good 10 minutes go by, no waiter/waitress, no napkins/silverware, no one to check on us! Our food was getting cold, we couldn't eat because we didn't have silverware!!  So I go inside and tell the Hostess we were not happy campers :( Our waitress sees this and comes to check on us and when told that we were not happy with the entire experience, the least we SHOULD get is silverware so we can eat our food... while I am still speaking, the waitress looks at me and says (as nasty as she could be)'Thanks for understanding' and took off! REALLY!!! Understand WHAT??? That after you seated us you forgot that we existed? Or assumed that we could eat our food with bare hands and wipe them with our clothes?? Understand WHAT?? That your entire team has no communication with each other and is lazy?? There was NOTHING for us to understand!  There was nobody outside besides the 2 of us !!! If you couldn't handle that, you should have told us it's closed outside! You ruined our evening, needless to say we were starving and had to go elsewhere for dinner!  Shameful! The manager didn't charge us for the 2 drinks although we wanted to pay for them; we didn't eat anything...chips were stale and salsa tasteless!

TPlsgmekeWP1ncI9KNanyQ.text: Service is always on point here. They know that everyone is on their lunch break so they make sure to take your order immediately so that you don't have to wait long for your food. I got the Vida Chicken which was a chicken break with 2 pieces of bacon on it along with guacamole, and cheese. This dish is now my favorite. It's so good. It al mixes together perfectly. I opted for extra rice since I don't like beans. Their rice goes great with the chicken. This place has a great vibe to it since it's so colorful and they have a great playlist of songs.

photos.caption: Photo of Vida Mexican Kitchen y Cantina - Charlotte, NC, United States

wA2ZHLuqD5rjfZTycrYqcQ.text: Vida is one of our go-to Mexican spots in Charlotte, especially when we have guests in town. We've rarely (if ever) had to wait for a table, even on weekends. I'm consistently impressed by the service we've received. Everyone is constantly keeping an eye on our drinks to make sure they're refilled and we usually get a refill of chips after we've scarfed down the first basket (because why not?).   I usually opt for the taco plate and leave stuffed with leftovers for lunch the next day. The "Shrimp Jalapeno Bacon" is a must-try; very flavorful and unique. Avoid the Carnitas; I'm usually a big fan, but every time I've tried them at Vida the pork has been too dry for my taste.   This past visit I tried the "Combo 1" that included a red chile chicken taco, carne asada steak taco, and a green chili pork and avocado enchilada, plus rice and beans. I'm proud of myself for going out of my comfort zone, but still recommend the tacos for dinner. My favorite part about the combo meal was the chicken taco; everything else was good, but again, a bit dry.   If you're a salad person, the Vida House is fantastic - very fresh, light, and some unique twists to your typical house salad at a Mexican restaurant (cilantro lime vinaigrette, jicama....). Yum.   4 stars because I think it's a bit pricey, but you do get a LOT of food for your buck.

nv8RiTOLfOS-TU3UW4MUNg.text: All the carnitas! It was the perfect day to sit outside and enjoy some of the delicious eats Vida has to offer. Our server was awesome and very attentive. Everyone tried something different and enjoyed their dishes, but my carnitas was a crowd pleaser...good thing I don't mind sharing-ha! Loved the pickled onion for contrast and how crispy they were.

photos.caption: Photo of Vida Mexican Kitchen y Cantina - Charlotte, NC, United States. Super crispy tasty carnitas!
Photo of Vida Mexican Kitchen y Cantina - Charlotte, NC, United States. Battered fish tacos, with rice and beans!

0Geg4rex1lf9eFzy7nUjpw.text: I really enjoyed my time at the Vegan night hosted by a meetup group I found. Vida Mexican Kitchen y Cantina offered a four-course meal that was 100% vegan.   I was super pleased to hear that the chef spent time creating the menu, ensuring the kitchen was cleaned properly, and that there were no traces of improper food exchanges while cooking. He made everything fresh and wow was it noticeable in the food.   I started with the chips and salsa which was very fresh, then they made fresh guacamole. For my entree, I selected the veggie tacos with rice and black beans. They also made vegan beverages, but I wasn't drinking that evening; however, my friends said it was really delicious.  My only pit about the event was the wait for our checks. I don't believe they were fully prepared for the processing of our bills. The items they created wasn't in the system so they had to manually enter in 15 orders which took about 40minutes. I would highly suggest for any future events that this is something they have programmed ahead of time. A lot of the guest was irritated and ready to leave.   I would recommend they offer more vegan entrees that they offered this night.

hYQOEjyprgYzNJQfSubUeA.text: TERRIBLE!!!!   I ordered a cheese quesadilla with rice, cilantro, and grilled onions inside. There was unfortunately chicken inside. The waitress argued that there was no chicken and then looked at me shocked when I lifted the tortilla up to find a hunk of meat. They also had the rice on the side and not inside.   Rice- incredibly spicy and not good  I ended up re ordering a plain cheese quesadilla and it was so spicy I couldn't eat it.   Margarita - ok, but very sweet  No apology from Vida, just bad all around!!

photos.caption: Photo of Vida Mexican Kitchen y Cantina - Charlotte, NC, United States. Outside - it&#39;s not good, don&#39;t waste your time or money
Photo of Vida Mexican Kitchen y Cantina - Charlotte, NC, United States. Outside - it&#39;s not good, don&#39;t waste your time or money
Photo of Vida Mexican Kitchen y Cantina - Charlotte, NC, United States. Outside - it&#39;s not good, don&#39;t waste your time or money

tnp6r_paXQIRtTwHioa_sA.text: The food was delicious and the price point was very affordable. There was a 1.5 hour wait for a table. This was a very popular restaurant for Cinco de Mayo. When they aren't busy give them a try.

nYJVcBKX-5d3oxr1x72xAA.text: So what if it's not authentic? So what if it's not the way your great Abuela makes It? This place may favor the American palette but It ain't Taco Bell! It's friggin delicious!   I've been here for lunch and dinner many times. Today I came with a group of friends for their first ever Drag Brunch. Food and a show? Count this piggy in!   We started with a brunch buffet. I gorged on the breakfast favorites- scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon and home fries. Eggs were seasoned well, home fries were cooked with onions for that extra oomph of flavor and bacon, well, bacon is never bad.   Then add in brunch the Vida way - chicken taquitos, mushroom sopes, carne asada y arroz, chorizo tacos and cheese quesadillas. Oh my goodness. No, I'm not even done yet. Throw in some pastries, cornbread, fresh fruit and countless tequila shots. Yep, that's how I Brunch!   Everything I ate was delicious but the chicken taquitos were by far my fave. There were 4 different salsas - but no chips. No worries, I sopped up the salsas with my meal. Well, meals. Let's face It, I probably had 4 full plates of food. Cheat day, ok?   After we ate, we enjoyed a wonderful show put on by the lovely ladies. This was their first Drag show at the restaurant and I really really really hope it's not the last. I enjoyed myself so much and know my girlfriends all did too.

A3jLT2ds2dFAKVbKMsVYgw.text: I never thought anything could be worst than airport food (you know the pre-made salads at the various kiosks) until I had the red Chile chicken chopped salad at Vida Mexican Kitchen for lunch. Talk about tasteless....It tasted like 4 day old chicken that's was left in the refrigerator uncovered. Now I understand why this place was almost empty at lunch time on Saturday. How can anyone mess up a salad? The chef really missed the mark on this one. When I sent the food back the bartender tasted it and agreed that something was off with the chicken. It would've been nice for the manager on duty to come by and ask why I was sending the food back but I guess he didn't care either.

xptMyxVxiXusHUOASqbY6Q.text: We really enjoyed this restaurant for dinner on our visit to Charlotte . The staff were very friendly. The food was quick and fast and really good.  We had the chimichanga style burrito and it comes with chips and salsa and also we had a taco salad. They were both super tasty and hot. The price was very reasonable also. I would definitely recommend this place to eat.

wwm1C1O3cp75xGWCD4mn6g.text: Enjoyed the queso and chips and salsa. Awful service. We were seated for at least an hour before getting our food. Never got our drinks until we bypassed the waitress and went to the bar ourselves for our drinks. They did comp our food so that was good. Hope to try again when they get the service issues fixed.

Xcp5AL7vPVI2YhPAHrNLzg.text: Server was great.  The food was good but more on the bland side than expect and small portions for the price.  A meal for 2 with 2 alcoholic beverages was $72.  Atmosphere was casual. The high top area area felt more casual and good for group of friends or coworkers. The table booth area looked more intimate and good for date.

MmWei5aY3h8AYU1o1U1Sjg.text: Came on a Friday night. It wasn't too packed. There are two parts to this place. A bar where it's small plates and a restaurant next door. We went to the restaurant there was an AKA event on the bar side. When we came in we were greeted and seated. Staff were nice. Had the skinny margarita which is weak. The server noted its alcohol mostly - not! I didn't get the regular or other options because they are pre made. Don't waste your money on his drink. We tried another the one of my favorites  in general a Brazilian drink, the Caipirinha. I'm so glad they didn't mess it up. It was good I could actually taste the alcohol. The server was busy didn't see him waiting on tables on our side, but it took him forever to bring stuff out.  I was happy that I was able to try various tacos instead of getting all one flavor. The beer battered cod/ fish taco was the best. It wasn't spicy but had a good amount of flavor. The chicken taco was horrible I was very surprised considering that most people eat chicken and lacked flavor. The shrimp taco with the jalapenos and bacon was super spicy. The rice wasn't cooked properly and the beans were just OK. I am shocked. Had better in food quality. I think you pay for location. Good luck.

photos.caption: Photo of Vida Mexican Kitchen y Cantina - Charlotte, NC, United States. Caipirinha
Photo of Vida Mexican Kitchen y Cantina - Charlotte, NC, United States. Right to left- cod taco, shrimp bacon jalapeño, and chicken taco- with black beans and rice.
Photo of Vida Mexican Kitchen y Cantina - Charlotte, NC, United States. Skinny margarita

F-01lk3cNwOOvNO9pUu6nA.text: The chips and salsa alone are worth the visit. The staff was incredibly welcoming (especially B who kept me and the other patrons company at the bar). The lunch portions were spot on. I'll be back, great job to the Vida team!

yk0TeCJsj2_i-iH3FnJ0ow.text: Sorry no pics good time, but I starting eating before I realized I had forgotten to take one! I had the carnitas, the chicken, and the steak tacos. All were really good. I had never been told that I could mix and match the tacos! Our server, I think Mitchell was his name, told me I could and it was an awesome idea. I must say the chicken was my favorite and since I go here for lunch on occasion I'm sure I'll get the chicken tacos again. I also had a mojito and although not my favorite it wasn't horrible. Maybe next time I'll try a different drink, but either way I thought the food was really good and worth another trip.

vsoJZ-Zsh-TkQYSTAMhrbA.text: Last night myself, boyfriend, and friends enjoyed my 41st bday dinner here and it was absolutely fabulous. From our prompt gracious servers to our amazing bartender Connor mixing up the most euphoric drinks, to the delicious food, I couldnt have asked for a better way to celebrate my special day..thank you to everyone last night ..superb

kxEOyyELsy-X7Fzrx3ASpw.text: I liked Vida but I've had so much better. I came with a large group and the service was great. All of the staff was nice and accommodating.   I ordered a quesadilla and it was good but I've had better at casual restaurants. It did come with guacamole for free! The rice and beans were horrible and cold- definitely cooked in bulk and then microwaved.   The corona-Rita was yummy and on special for $6.   Overall, I wouldn't come back just because it was nothing special.

photos.caption: Photo of Vida Mexican Kitchen y Cantina - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Quesadilla. Comes with everything on the side. The sour cream tasted like ranch dressing to me.

p5tEM04nJoYm2UjHVAoYNA.text: The salsa and chips were good but the salads had lettuce that looked like it was cut a few days ago. I had to eat around it because I was really hungry and I HATE sending things back. The service was good, though.

EIopn567bKr6YxcZaI_dBQ.text: Promising when we saw it from outside and sat down. Has an upstairs seating, a bar and booths to choose from and looked busy.  The service was surprisingly slow though and the server looked hurried and a little harassed to be honest but very courteous and doing the best he could  A glass of water or some more salsa etc took a while to appear for example... slightly busy crowd but not to the point where the service was so slow  The enchiladas and the house salad was delicious though . The salad was fresh and the chicken was freshly prepared it looked like.  The enchiladas were fresh off the stove and steaming and tasted just the way chicken enchiladas should (just enough of spices and just enough of tenderness)

Photo of Vida Mexican Kitchen y Cantina - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Vida Mexican Kitchen y Cantina - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vida house salad with chicken

UZXiIRdXn0QGU04LDbHbdA.text: For a Mexican place in a mall like setting, I expected something average, but boy what a pleasant surprise.  Vida Rocks.  The chips and salsa are good (check), the drinks are good (check check), and the enchiladas and tacos are tasty(check, check, check).  There are many great sounding items on the menu, and the combos are a great way to help you sample several different items.  Ricky the water was super efficient and very friendly.  Oh, and they are open late weeknights for a good late night meal option.

HiNig8tBYISsMjLvEkGJlA.text: Seemed promising at first. The salsa and chips were delicious. The food was not authentic at all, not even passable. The food had no levels of flavor, just heat. The atmosphere was great. But unless you are having only drinks and chips I wouldn't go there ever again....I get better mexican up north...

68b5VLniFlFWOmc9WOLi0A.text: This is one of the times I really wish we could do half stars, cause 5 stars should only be for perfect meals and it wasn't quite there, but it was close.  A definite 4.5  From reading the other reviews I kinda wonder if this is the same restaurant.  We called 45 mins in advance on restaurant week, and they said no problem.  Place was packed when we got there, but we were seated right away.  Chips, salsa, and water almost instantly.  We were obviously wanting drinks, so our waitress asked quickly, but it took us a while to decide.  She came by 3 times before we were ready.  Finally said Partita Margaritas for all.  Sweetened with agave nectar, so not too sweet and better for you.  We had the table side guac, that I thought was pretty tasty.  Was hoping for a performance or something of the sort, but was still nice.  I had the tortilla soup, good, but not memorable.  As per entrees.  I sat and looked at all the taco's over and over.  I wanted to do the mix and match of 3, but everybody else at the table was doing that.  Knew I could just poke at those.  I went for the Salmon with Manchamantel Sauce.  Never heard of it before, so what the hey.  The sauce was simple but spot on.  A kind of fruity puree with adobo sauce.  SPOT ON!  The salmon was tasty but a hair over salted.  No consistency between every body's sides.  Corn with queso fresco was awesome, plantains were pretty good.  Red chile rice and beans were good also.  They messed up on the cole slaw.  no papaya, very little pineapple.  Mostly just raw cabbage.  Have had better at crappy hot dog carts.  The sauteed greens were so salty there were barely edible.  Then dessert, OH YEAH!  Not normally my thing, but i did the restaurant week deal and nobody else did, so figured I'd share.  Mango crisp was like grandma's apple pie with Hagen Daz ice cream.  Highly recommended.  A little pricey for Mexican, but you can get out pretty cheap compared to the rest of the epicenter.  A must try if your in the area.

lIk5Ln3o3_Xy8OmXf0fIcA.text: I have been here twice and after the first time I realized that this isn't the best mexican food out there. I have had better mexican in Charlotte. However it is a good place to have drinks while catching up with friends.   I enjoy spicy mexican food so Vida isn't the best option for me, but those who do not like spicy do enjoy this place.   I have had their margaritas and they are great. Their guacamole is also really good and their salsa is good, the spicy salsa (you have to ask for it) is really good and definitely has a kick.

CCFDPDfzkLFZ17j5uAN6yQ.text: First, let me say that they have great customer service. Everyone serving us was super nice, friendly, and helpful.  Prices are a little expensive, and some portions are a little small, but even so, it's all full of flavor and deliciousness. All in all, this place is pretty solid. I think this would be a good place to come with friends for some after-hour drink and food specials before getting your night started.

yQm7kucYuTFclB__zi7R2A.text: I knew this place was going to open sometime at the end of the year, but hadn't been hanging around Epicenter lately so didn't realize it was fully operational.  Now that I've moved back to the city it was time to start walking around to start getting reacquainted with the Queen city.  So the GF and I put on our coats and started walking.  I have to admit it is nice to be able to just step out 4 or 5 blocks and have a pick of bars, restaurants, art, and entertainment....but I digress. With a facade of glass, Vida is very inviting from the street.  Entering the restaurant there is dining to the left and above on a second level and to the right there is bar (also a small bar on the second level). Tonight was casual, so it was the bar.  We were also a bit hungry, so food was also in order.  The bar was busier than the restaurant, but we were able to grab some seats right by the wait station.  We had our drink orders taken and also menus for food.  Drinks came and we decided on guacamole which I had just heard earlier that day was "to die for" so we decided to try it out.  Now 1511 is the KING of guacamole in my opinion and with Vida pricing it at $11 and a few more dollars more than 1511 I had to see what it was all about. Chips and salsa was served, but almost after our first set of drinks were done....this was a foretelling of things to come with the bar staff and particularly our designated bartender & waiter (we'll call her Grace to protect the innocent).....more on that later.  Sorry I don't have more on the food, but I'll do the best I can with the one dish.  The chips were good and the salsa was a bit different.  Subtle which we think had to do with it being made fresh as it appeared to be though we cannot say for sure.  My beer is finished...bottle empty on the bar....and I wait for Grace to inquire to another one....and wait...and wait......  So the guacamole comes...a gentleman which is dressed as though he works in the kitchen brings the MASSIVE guac bowl.  It was huge!!!!  He saw our faces and placed the bowl down with a big thud...just to make a point which in turn we all laughed.  Then we asked about the size.  It seems Vida uses 3 avocados for their table side whereas 1511 uses only 2.  Now is that work an extra $2 to $3?  Not sure.  What I am sure about is that if you don't have a healthy appetite you'll definitely have a To-Go container full of this stuff.  My beer order is finally filled....  We eat....and eat....and eat....and eat.................and still eat.....beer gone.  Now this time Grace along with the other female bartender are standing right in front of us just talking to each other........my bottle sitting their empty continues to sit there.........and the bar staff continues to chat.  Though my career is Finance & Banking, I also have over 5 years of bartending expereience and managing a bar, so I know that you need to be on the ball to be a good bartender...to anticipate customer needs...to be one step ahead and think for your customer so they just have the experience...not think about the little things..............Grace evidently does not understand this or cares.......nor does Management watch them perform in this manner.  It's a beer I know.....but in the end it was also a $50 tab, so it is my hard earned money and I'm finding in this town there are a few number of choices.....and a belief from the owners of these places that being "best in class" or professional levels of service are more of a footnote than a serious consideration....sorry for the soap box, but this is a tough economy.....  Perhaps Grace is one of the many millions of Americans waiting for the job market to heat back up so they can go and get a job that pays more?????  Regardless, my money is real enough and I'd like to stretch those dollars with the best experience as possible.  Vida's bar staff was not the ones totally providing it to me that evening.  They weren't bad mind you...but then again they weren't great either.  So, back to the guacamole............we actually ALMOST finished all of it.  And one last beer....which I have to give Grace an ok here as she did get this one faster........but then again, the bar had totally cleared out with only a few people, so it wasn't so difficult for her this time.  The guacamole is very fresh....with tons of cilantro and all manner of chunks of veggies.....very good....right now a tie with 1511, though price and size make it almost in a different class.  Decor is cool and laid back with earth tones.  The floor near the bar is interesting with slices of wood embedded in it.  What cracked me up is in the men's bathroom they have a wall made out of decorative concrete blocks like one would use to find in cheap hotels from the 70s, but the application here proved to be successful.  Plenty of TVs for watching games, so a nicer hang out for games in the coming year.  All and all a "good" place, but I'm holding onto a few stars until I eat in the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Vida Mexican Kitchen y Cantina - Charlotte, NC, United States. Guacamole  as big as your head!!!

tC_mpFYJNx5GHXriGN0Oag.text: First time here and I'm in love with Vida! Just had their Chimichanga burrito with shrimp and it was the best I ever had! It was super tasty ! Their coronitas were awesome as well! Service was exceptional. Our server Cameron was super friendly and on point. Drinks were fill and our table was kept clean through the entire meal. I'll be back soon !

H15Rq8-j82jHStoxBwVMaA.text: Amazing food :) try the Carne Asada Tostada Salad... Yummmm!!!

RZKz8F09zpbCHpuJyYzUMw.text: Ok so I know there are some people hating on the Vida but I've been nothing but pleased during my visits there. I am totally digging that there is another option Uptown for Mexican besides the fast food Mexican places like Salsarita's and Qdoba. Some co-workers and I went for lunch today since one  had a free guacamole coupon and  were the first ones there. After 10 minutes of being there, the dining area was almost packed so obviously this place is doing something right. We had prompt service with a friendly and knowledgeable server who gladly gave honest suggestions on what to order (seriously, request Matthew-he is wonderful!).   The rolling guac cart came around right after we had our water filled and started to go to town on the fresh made guac. I love anything that I can see being made in front of me. Served along with that were some of the freshest and warm tortilla chips I've ever had with just the right touch of salt. And the guac? I almost asked guac man for his hand in marriage since it was rich, creamy and delightful. I wanted to scrape the bottom of the bowl but didn't think that would be ok since it was a business lunch and all. Our server suggested the carnitas tacos so I had to go with that and dare I say there were the best I've had (and I'm an Arizona transplant so I like to think I know good Mexican food). I had the plantain and black bean mash with was equally as awesome. We had no problems at all and checks were given in timely manner. I left with a feeling of happiness from exceptional service, amazing food and a food baby sitting in my belly. This place is one block away from my office which is going to be way dangerous for me but also way good for me.

sfXuGC6usToGmZoRaVWb4w.text: We ordered the shrimp taco dinner and ground beef burrito for 30.   - Nice atmosphere. Great jazz music. Cool tequila bar. But feels far from authentic Mexican.   - Cold chips with our first serving and crispy hot our second. inconsistent.  - Only one salsa dip!? LOL. Salsa fail big time.  - Server said shrimp taco was his favorite. Pretty average. Comes with Mango. Not something I'd pay $15 again for.  - Corn tastes as if were canned or maybe frozen. - Optional: order burrito fried. cool.  - Burrito is short and stubby. The ground beef reminds me of that in a Chinese egg roll.  - Service was pleasant. Great with refills. Watch it though,.."Any more boxes, LADIES" WTF... - Spoiled with great Mexican eats in Los Angeles and San Diego, this place taste like an over-priced Baja Fresh. City Center Charlotte will sure disappoint you when it comes to Mexican food. Chevy's would be a better alternative. haha. ouch.

85UK1OH4o5HvXRmocpHH4Q.text: This place is terrible. I had been here once just visiting a friend and didn't enjoy but tried it again when I moved here to see if maybe it was just a bad experience. It wasn't. The staff are great but the food is BLAND. I'm used to Mexican food being very flavorful and I'm not even a fan of spicy and this stuff is just blah. The best part was the chips and salsa but who can screw that up? I didn't even like the queso. My only recommendation if you're forced to go here is to sit at the bar, have some drinks and chips/salsa and then run.

9OC8jSQ9WHszMEBXeU5nGQ.text: A bit pricey, but it is "high-end" Mexican cuisine. I've tasted various items on this menu, from the combos, to the tacos and burritos, everything is always so well prepared. I've experienced a few soggy tortillas at times, but that's just to be expected when dealing with corn tortillas. The service is always outstanding, the bartenders are always attentive and accommodating. While this is not as "authentic" as going to a mom and pop type of Mexican restaurant, the spin they put on it helps you indulge in the flavors of Mexico without worrying about eating too much. Aside from that, the frozen margarita has me feeling so good by the end of the meal that I can never order less than 1. Vida is definitely a staple (for me), just as long as they keep making those margaritas just right.

uDW8a2tF7RzpaezfGgBptg.text: They really did a wonderful job on their grand opening.  I was quite impressed.  The service was fantastic, even with a full house and it being their first big day. They really use the space well, it's a bit oddly shaped inside (it's on a rounded corner in Epicentre).   The bar area is spacious and there are long tables to stand and enjoy cocktails at while you wait for your table.    Our server, Jackie, was very knowledgeable, nice and amusing.  She recommended the carnitas, which my boyfriend ordered.  I had the barbacoa.  She made sure our food didn't come out too close to the tableside guac.  We joined "The Good Life" club before going so we had a coupon for  a free tableside guacamole.  Which was MASSIVE.  I swear he use like 6 avocados!  It was very tasty and we ate so much of the yummy guac that by the time our food came I was almost full. I definitely recommend joining "The Good Life" and using the coupon, it's was some seriously good guac.    The barbacoa was just as barbacoa should be, tender and almost melt in your mouth.  I thought the sauce was a bit too sweet, but they didn't smother it in the sauce so it was okay.  The carnitas was definitely the better choice, it was smokey and slightly crisp.  We weren't too fond of the taco shells (they're similar to Loco Lime's) and slightly sweet.  It might just be that they're corn and that's how freshly made corn tortillas taste, but they were a little too heavy and sweet for me.  Jackie told us they come from a family business in Monroe and are brought in fresh every morning.  They are trying to use as much locally sourced products as possible.    The plantains were outstanding, i'm a huge sucker for properly done plantains, I also had the black beans and they were equally yummy.  The carnitas came with lettuce, guac and cheese and the barbacoa came with a mexican slaw which was okay, i'm not a slaw fan of any kind so i'm not the best judge.    Be forewarned, the drinks are STRONG.  I had a frozen strawberry margarita and it was very heavy on the tequila.    We had churros for dessert, which were a little too doughy in the middle for me, but the outside was perfect and they come with chocolate to dip them in.   My only complaint was the Abercrombie & Fitch music.  My boyfriend commented that he felt like he should be buying clothes not eating.  A little too club dance party for a restaurant.  I get that they're trying to be hip, but that's a bit too hip while i'm eating dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Vida Mexican Kitchen y Cantina - Charlotte, NC, United States. churros

CI6_PcsE0EPh_WyxplvVXg.text: So finally I made it back to Vida after enjoying their soft opening a while back...ole!   As others have mentioned - the decor is lovely. It's a well appointed restaurant with plenty of booths, large bar area, great patio (perfect for people watching) and sweet upstairs area for smaller groups. Our service last night was just about perfect - efficient, friendly, helpful and considerate. Case and point? Hubs and I dined with another couple, and my friend is about 7 months pregnant. When the server brought three of us our margaritas, etc. she also brought a mocktail for my buddy with baby. Sweet!   Here's my take on the food...  Guacamole: 5/5: Some of my favorite guacamole in Charlotte. It was super fresh, well made and gigantic. The four of us barely finished it. It may be more expensive than other places, but it is delicious and feeds many.   Skinny Margarita: 4/5: It is indeed a skinny margarita. I believe Vida touts this as fewer than 100 calories. It's a good margarita - especially for that caloric intake.   Chicken Enchiladas: 4/5: I thought I ordered the chicken & roasted corn enchiladas...but maybe they were just plain chicken. Regardless, they were flavorful, cheesy and filling. While some may say $14+ for enchiladas is pricey, this portion was mighty large and with the two sides I was plenty full.   Fried Plantains: 4/5: I love fried plantains. These are done right, albeit a teeny tiny bit greasy.   Corn con Queso: 3/5: It's a general ear of roasted corn with a bit of queso. Nothing to write home about, but it was fine overall.   So, overall a really solid experience at Vida. I'll be back soon...as long as I come with a reservation!

photos.caption: Photo of Vida Mexican Kitchen y Cantina - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab &amp; shrimp enchiladas

MI1bWJEm6MskimZ-r7g2PA.text: Surprisingly good guessied-up Mexican food.  Be sure to get the tableside guacamole, which is as good as everybody says.    My entree was carne asada, which was fine and tasty, although probably not quite worth the price.  Overall, the food isn't bland-- it just tastes strongly of lime and salt and little else.

1R0UWgDPV8KPm49KIMbPTQ.text: I'm basing this review only on the lime shrimp salad because it's all I ever get! I freaking love this salad.  Plenty of avocado, crunchy jicama, sweet mango chunks, and the most wonderful garlicky shrimp you've ever had. It's one of my favorite salads in Charlotte! I also really like the salsa they serve with the chips. It's got a great flavor and isn't watery like so many Mexican restaurants serve.    I just had lunch here and our server overheard my friend and I talking about her birthday. She treated us to a piece of Banana Tres Leches cake "roasted banana tres leches with Mexican coffee creme anglaise". I really am a sucker for tres leches but I am also very critical of it. Once you have a good one, it's hard to beat. This is not your everyday tres leches. The banana flavor is not overpowering, but is just enough to get that flavor.  The whipped cream on top had a nutmeg flavor that was so warm and delicious.  I mean, I want to go back and get another piece! It's a MUST try.

NGgMXU2ElghulDsstFYpuw.text: Our Waitress was excellent. I ordered the Salmon and it was the driest Salmon I have ever eaten. My waitress quickly changed my order and I got the taco that were great. My wife ordered some pork and green chili's plate and it was amazing. In fact I added it to my tacos and oh my!!!

IdtYVnBWw5biyQoHGzGLpg.text: My food (carnitas) were really good as were the chips and salsa.  My wife's food, however, was really bland.  Overall, this is a reasonable restaurant with good service and OK food.  Nothing to write home about, but not great either.

hZNIGtKZbIMWABZCRdODoA.text: Pricey, but tasty! I love the guac and the enchiladas. Last time I was there I also had a pretty good margarita. I would eat at Vida more and give it 5 stars if it was a bit more reasonably priced. Last time I was there the host was a little snooty about my group not having a reservation even though the restaurant wasn't very busy.

fV3Aeys7jhYxINLwZMxAWQ.text: After a few trips here for their soft opening a few months ago, I finally got back for a full meal. Very good IMO! Went here with another couple and started with the tableside guac, which like everyone says, is huge and awesome! Server was a little weird, but fun, and was quick with the drink orders and recommendations.   Ordered the carne asada tacos and they were good! My only complaint was that the plate had so much going on that I couldn't get through it all and truly dissect the meal. Not a problem though as I didn't have much room left after the trough of guac :). Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Vida Mexican Kitchen y Cantina - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brisket tacos!

_ORDgDcd73-I5CMjliZT5w.text: Visited Vida MexicanKitchen y Cantina during a brunch crawl.  A modern restaurant with a retro feel.  They had high top tables, regular ones and even counter service.    Menu was plentiful; many choices.  Mimosas and a corona light started our tab.  The mimosa here were far stronger then one of the adjacent bars.  Definite worth the price point of $4.00.    The chips and queso were excellent.  One of my friends thought it was a little think...I thought it was a perfect consistency.  The portion of each meal was large.  Many taking a to go bag with them.  Service was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Vida Mexican Kitchen y Cantina - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu
Photo of Vida Mexican Kitchen y Cantina - Charlotte, NC, United States. Inside.

3Qx2U-HPznVQf-zE-x2yRw.text: Decided to stop in here last Saturday after a visit to a museum. I thought the decor was very lively and super colorful. It was a tad cold so that made it hard to enjoy my time . If you check in you'll get a free queso and chips . I really liked the queso. I was pleasantly surprised at the prices especially being in the Epic Centre. One taco was about $3.50 and the combos were about $8. The tacos were big. I was satisfied with one. I ordered the buffalo chicken taco and I asked for no blue cheese. It came with blue cheese and I had to send it back. The new one took forever.  I thought the service was just so so. Our server seemed neither interested or uninterested. It was hard for me to gage her vibe. Overall, I will probably come back . I'll like to try their fish bowls.  Also, after reading other reviews I'm disappointed that we didn't receive salsa ? Is that the trade off between free queso is no salsa ? I sure wish someone would have told us.

rwcZ8C_iMbEajI3xzsQgBQ.text: This is a fun restaurant to grab some Mexican food. I went for the tacos and they have a variety of flavor combos to chose from. Every one that I had was very tasty! We came mid-afternoon and service was great. Our waiter was very friendly.

vAXbXsRj-_aYkG6tx2vz3g.text: Tacos were pretty good, they have a lobster roll type taco rolling for the month of August. Highly recommend but the PABG tag goes to the Carnitas taco... Spot on baby. If and when you go make sure to go on Wednesday night as they do Gay Trivia given by some fabulous guest MCs. Not only is it tasty but fairly inexpensive, the tacos are less then $3.50-$4.00 (lobster is $6.50... it's lobster.) it is a bit small but no worries they have outdoor seating. It is Uptown so the draw back is paying to park and it's near the Epicenter so if you don't want to deal with the bar crowd could put a damper on your experience but then again you are in a bar so... When you go YELP and you're a good for FREE Queso dip. Eat, Drin

vG6pTuOBpblbub5D_5BCjQ.text: I came here with some of my coworkers for lunch.  It took a little while for us to get service to start - meaning we had enough time to review the menu and discuss what each of us were thinking about getting.  Once we did get service, we were promptly given our drinks along with chips and salsa.  I do appreciate the fact that they brought two dishes of salsa and chips for the four of us.  While not the best salsa, it didn't stop me from eating a lot of it!  I ordered the combo with the quesadilla and the spinach and mushroom enchilada.  I appreciated the ability to order a couple different items to try, and glad I did - because I was originally just thinking of the enchilada.  The enchilada was awful.  I cannot pinpoint the exact flavor that I did not like, but it was not edible for me, so I just stuck with the quesadilla, which is hard to mess up.  It was alright to me, and at least edible.  The combo was served with rice and black beans, so plenty of food.  I probably do not see myself going back here with so many other lunch options that you can actually enjoy, but it was worth a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Vida Mexican Kitchen y Cantina - Charlotte, NC, United States. Quesadillas (okay) and mushroom enchilada (awful) combo

UbMa9cyEHbnSk9KOG84TnQ.text: I saw a big sign that said "Cantina" on the outside that hooked me off the bat! A very cool ambiance when you walk in they have booths and tables to the left, upstairs seating and a bar and high top seating to the right. I decided to sit at the bar because we had a show to go to and usually the bar is a bit quicker. Well the bartender looked super annoyed we even sat at the bar, she barely greeted us and seemed to be in a very unpleasant mood. I ordered queso dip which when it finally did come out it was cold and the cheese had hardened as it does when it sits there for awhile. She made a good margarita not great. I ordered the steak fajita salad and my friend ordered carne asada tacos. The tacos were good. My salad was different not a traditional fajita salad but I would say a nice change I would maybe add some pico or a more flavorful dressing. My full experience was only a 2 star rating because of the service. I wouldn't mind coming back to try this place again but for sure would stay clear of that rude bartender.

RxKuhLIALCFcezhZbAg5bQ.text: Blah. Nothing stood out from the service to the food. Waiter had a snotty attitude which was an immediate turnoff.   Chicken quesadillas were a bore. Salsa was loose and unappealing. Chips were chips lol. Out of the party of 5 no one raved over their meal.  Due to the poor experience the only tips left were written notes to the waiter to DO BETTER. Well someone must not have cared for the tips much because they chose to write in a tip ($) on one of the bills which we didn't notice until the next day.   Needless to say I would never return or recommend this place to anyone

pdIlt237mPim_UZ9tTBKRg.text: Oh man, the food here was disgusting lol. Usually I rate a place based on service and food, but the food was so bad that this place deserves this one star.  You go to a mexican place and you want some burritos right? What do you expect? Well, a nice tortilla, good fillings, fresh ingredients, at least better than fast food like Chipotle.   This place was like, trash. That's being friendly. Burrito was super soggy, covered in melted American cheese?! With some GREEN vomit looking like thing on top. Absolutely gross. Inside? Soggy meat, soggy rice, sogg sogg sogg.  Definitely stay away.

photos.caption: Photo of Vida Mexican Kitchen y Cantina - Charlotte, NC, United States. GROSSSSSS

RJKvM2DMYNP5aLyKWLWF-w.text: We stopped in here for dinner before heading to a concert recently. We were quickly seated in the bar area and greeted quickly by our waiter. We ordered drinks and also started with the traditional guac and queso dip. They give every table chips and salsa, and honestly... the salsa alone is worth it! It's so good and fresh. It's definitely homemade. I ordered a taco salad with ground beef. The lettuce was dressed in their homemade dressing and it gave the salad a nice flavor. Between the flavors and the service, I would definitely come back here again! I'm happy to have found this place!

Once the charge cleared it was an additional amount posted for a tip in which I did not authorize. I guess they just decided to give themselves a hefty tip on me since my daughter was intoxicated!!

Tac5022feAMvOX6cioJ6gQ.text: These are probably some of the best tacos I have ever had! I was visiting Charlotte for my fiance's birthday. We stayed in the epic center so we decided to try this place. I have never had or heard of a Philly cheesesteak taco. It was mouth watering that I had to order more. The pricing is pretty high, $4 or more for a taco but it's worth it because it's packed with protein! The black beans was pretty awesome too. I also had the shrimp taco and fish taco which was nothing short of amazing as well. I gave it four stars only because like traditional Mexican restaurants it didn't come with complimentary chips and salsa, which is always a plus for eating at a Mexican restaurant. The next day I had to go back for more! The waitress was really helpful and attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Vida Mexican Kitchen y Cantina - Charlotte, NC, United States. Philly cheesesteak taco, fish taco, shrimp taco, black beans and rice

fXXL06yKMdaIZHHWZDLLDA.text: So I understand that Mexican food is a common cuisine and this restaurant has typical entrees BUT the carne asada quesadilla is not even close to ordinary. I order this entree every time and try to figure out what it is about the flavors that I find so addicting, and still no luck. Even as I look at the picture, I know that it looks so ordinary but it's sooo good! Add Cholula sauce on top and I promise you will be hooked too!

k7LWQX-9RybfhzM8Aold-A.text: VIDA is our lunch spot!  It's not a good week if we can't get to VIDA.  We are always greeted with friendly faces and the service is one of the top reasons we go.  Kenny is wonderful!  He treats us like family and makes our visit fun.  Joe is also excellent!!!!  Joe anticipates our every need and is very efficient.  Fell in love with the queso and the Tortilla Pie!!!  Overall, one of my favs!!!

HNoKAkCzbhfu3txLyPJyOg.text: We went for brunch after #JWU19 graduation woot woot! I had Bacon, Egg And Cheese Quesadilla... flour tortilla filled with applewood smoked bacon, caramelized onions, three scrambled eggs and our specialty blend of cheeses, topped with pico de gallo.  And a Mexican type mimosa ( I don't remember the name) it was absolutely delicious.  I didn't want to share because it was so good.

hW0vnIz2rhbZR2a8unwVEg.text: Had a great margarita to help celebrate Cinco de Mayo. The chips & salsa/queso were great!

photos.caption: Photo of Vida Mexican Kitchen y Cantina - Charlotte, NC, United States

2I6DQIZgdHwXQ5RDDiZgQw.text: We came here for margaritas on "National Margarita Day" so this review is strictly off of atmosphere and margaritas. I will update if/when we come back.   The margarita tasted like it had too much sour mix and was quite sweet. For $7.99, I expect a bigger glass or a little bit of a better crafted beverage. That said, we enjoyed the DJ and busy atmosphere.    I think we will come back eventually to order some food. I'd like to see if the margaritas are better when it's less crowded, but I may order an upgraded margarita to see if that is better. In my opinion, every restaurant [and especially a Mexican-themed restaurant] needs to have a good house margarita.

photos.caption: Photo of Vida Mexican Kitchen y Cantina - Charlotte, NC, United States

_nFo_sMnil0vpfiQPa9DiA.text: My office crew eats here at least once a week. Always great service and excellent food.  Ricky & Joe are awesome!  Forgot to mention Kenny too!!  They all provide us with excellent service!

8VOeNPijayZIG45UBkOASg.text: Vida has ridiculous good food right in the heart of uptown. A group of coworkers came here for lunch it was nothing but good food and good service.  Start with the guacamole. It's fresh and delicious with chunky pieces of avocado. They bring chips and salsa to the table. The salsa is also fresh with a spicy kick. No oily chips here.   For my lunch, I had two tacos. You can mix and match if you want to try different items. So I ordered the shrimp with jalapeno bacon and a shredded beef taco. It also came with beans and rice. I loved both tacos. There are amazing sauces on each one. The shrimp were plump and tasty. And the combination between the sweet mango and spicy jalapeno paired well. The shredded beef taco was seasoned very well. And the avocado poblano sauce on top was spicy and creamy.   The only thing I disliked was the seating. We were at a high top and there were no purse hooks or good places to put our coats. Other than that, I highly recommend this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Vida Mexican Kitchen y Cantina - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chips and Guac
Photo of Vida Mexican Kitchen y Cantina - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp taco, shredded beef taco, rice and beans.

hHLHxRTNMl-J99IWEde7gA.text: This is a bad imitation of mexican restaurant, the nachos were really bad the extensive use of caned cheese sauce is insane. The burrito was full of canned tomatoes with no rice or carnitas at all, had to start digging into it to find some meat and rice.   The tortilla was gummy and burned on the borders topical of microwaved food.  This is not a mexican restaurant this is a fast food some one decided to call mexican. Even the margaritas are mixed in a juice cooler don't waste your money or time on it  find another place.

M1wXxoSdNGOwrhxN-RRlmw.text: Food: 3.5 stars Value: 3 stars Service: 1 star  I came to Vida Kitchen earlier for lunch. I have been to the Cantina many times and enjoyed it every time - I give the Cantina side 4 stars. This review is for the Kitchen. My coworkers and I stopped by for a nice sit-down lunch, there were 6 of us.  Here is my issue. I hate to rate this place so low, as the food is decently good for the price, and the food came out quickly. Our server was absolutely awful.
